<<<code>>>: You can use the following code to scroll to the desired position in a ListView and click on the item:
```scss
Solo.sleep(2000); // Wait for 2 seconds
Solo.clickOnView(Activity.findViewById(R.id.list_view)); // Scroll to the top of the ListView
Solo.sleep(100); // Wait for 100 milliseconds
Solo.clickOnView(Activity.findViewById(R.id.list_item_0)); // Click on the first item in the ListView
```
This code will wait for 2 seconds, scroll to the top of the ListView, wait for 100 milliseconds, and then click on the first item in the ListView. This should be done on the UI thread to avoid the RuntimeException you are encountering.

You can also use the `scrollToPosition()` method of the ListView to scroll to a specific position, like this:
```scss
Solo.sleep(2000); // Wait for 2 seconds
Solo.clickOnView(Activity.findViewById(R.id.list_view)); // Scroll to the top of the ListView
Solo.scrollToPosition(Activity.findViewById(R.id.list_view), 0); // Scroll to the first item in the ListView
Solo.clickOnView(Activity.findViewById(R.id.list_item_0)); // Click on the first item in the ListView
```
This code will wait for 2 seconds, scroll to the top of the ListView, scroll to the first item in the ListView, and then click on the first item in the ListView. This should also be done on the UI thread to avoid the RuntimeException.

Note that you should also ensure that any other actions you perform after clicking on the item are also done on the UI thread, to avoid further RuntimeExceptions.
